Description: ACCORDING TO THE NATIONAL SHOOTING SPORTS FOUNDATION AN ESTIMATED 51 MILLION ADULTS PARTICIPATED IN SOME TYPE OF TARGET OR SPORT SHOOTING IN 2014 WHICH IS AN INCREASE FROM 34 MILLION IN 2009. THE TEXAS PARKS AND WILDLIFE DEPARTMENT (TPWD) IS COMMITTED TOMEETING THE DEMAND FOR EDUCATION IN SHOOTING SPORTS AND CREATING SAFE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROMOTE SAFE, RESPONSIBLE AND KNOWLEDGEABLE PARTICIPATION IN SHOOTING SPORTS AND PATHWAYS TO HUNTING THROUGH INTRODUCTORY PROGRAMS IN ARCHERY AND FIREARMS.

HUNTING IS A LONG STANDING TRADITION IN THE STATE OF UTAH AND AN IMPORTANT PART OF OUR HERITAGE. THE DIVISION OF WILDLIFE RESOURCES IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING STRUCTURED OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS TO BE INTRODUCE TO SHOOTING AND HUNTING, AS WELL AS PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THOSE ALREADY INVOLVED IN THE SPORT TO IMPROVE THEIR SKILLS AND FOSTER CONTINUED INTEREST IN PARTICIPATION OR TO REACTIVATE PAST PARTICIPANTS. THE HUNTER EDUCATION OUTREACH AND SHOOTING SPORT EFFORTS PROVIDE MANY OF THESE OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUR CITIZENS.THIS GRANT PROJECT PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE UTAH HUNTER EDUCATION OUTREACH AND SHOOTING SPORTS PROGRAMS. PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION INCLUDES: PLANNING, CONDUCTING OR SUPPORTING A VARIETY OF LOCAL, REGIONAL AND STATE LEVEL EVENTS DESIGNED TO INCREASE INTEREST AND PARTICIPATION IN HUNTING, TRAPPING OR SHOOTING SPORTS ACTIVITIES  VOLUNTEER TRAINING AND RECOGNITION  PROCUREMENT OF ASSOCIATED SUPPLIES AND MATERIALS, ETC.

THE PURPOSE OF THE ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY PROGRAM IS TO CREATE AND ENHANCE INTEREST IN SHOOTING SPORTS FOR SCHOOL-AGED STUDENTS IN GRADES 4TH-12TH AND TO ENHANCE YOUTH ADULT PARTICIPATION WITHIN COMMUNITIES. THE APPROACH IS TO TRAIN TEACHERS AND OTHER COMMUNITY LEADERS USING THE NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM (NASP) FORMAT. NASP FORMAT IS TO BE USED TO PRESENT ARCHERY LESSONS TO STUDENTS IN SCHOOL, DURING THE DAY, AND TO YOUTH ADULTS IN COMMUNITY PROGRAMS. WE EXPECT STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN EXPOSED TO ARCHERY, A SHOOTING SPORT, TO CARRY THAT INTEREST OUTSIDE OF THE CLASSROOM AND PURSUE OTHER SHOOTING, HUNTING, AND OUTDOOR RELATED ACTIVITIES ON THEIR OWN.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THE HUNTER RECRUITMENT, RETENTION AND REACTIVATION (R3) PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF NEW HUNTERS AND TRAPPERS ENTERING THE SPORT, REDUCE THE NUMBER OF HUNTERS AND TRAPPERS LEAVING THE SPORT AND ENCOURAGE INACTIVE HUNTERS AND TRAPPERS TO BECOME ACTIVE PARTICIPANTS ONCE AGAIN.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF ELEVEN SHOOTING RANGES AND ENHANCED HUNTER EDUCATION TRAINING.1. PROVIDE OVERSIGHT FOR SAFETY, STAFFING, AND MAINTENANCE FOR 11 PUBLIC SHOOTING RANGES TO SUPPORT FWC S HUNTER EDUCATIONPROGRAM AND TO PROVIDE THE PUBLIC A SAFE PLACE TO IMPROVE THEIR MARKSMANSHIP SKILLS.2. PROVIDE OVERSIGHT FOR TRAINING TEACHERS TO INSTRUCT THE NASP PROGRAM AND COORDINATE REGIONAL AND STATE COMPETITIONS.3. PROVIDE OVERSIGHT FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION FOR HUNTER SAFETY GRADUATES IN THE NASP PROGRAM AND COORDINATE REGIONAL AND STATECOMPETITIONS.4. THE OBJECTIVE FOR THE EQUIPMENT PURCHASES IS TO PROVIDE OTHER EQUIPMENT FOR THE SAFE OPERATION OF SHOOTING RANGES AND FORINSTRUCTORS TO USE IN HUNTER EDUCATION PROGRAM.
TO CONSTRUCT DEVELOP A 50-YARD ARCHERY RANGE ON CITY PARK PROPERTY IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY.

SOUTH DAKOTA GFP S ENHANCED HUNTER EDUCATION PROGRAM PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM (NASP) AND SHOOTING RELATED SPORTS PROGRAMS. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS GRANT IS TO TRAIN 342 NASP INSTRUCTORS MENTORS, TO HAVE 4,000 STUDENTS COMPLETE NASP TRAINING, AND TO CONDUCT EIGHT NASP TRAINING EVENTS. THE EXPECTED RESULTS AND BENEFITS ARE TO HELP THE PUBLIC DEVELOP AND PRACTICE SHOOTING SKILLS. THE NASP PROGRAM WILL PROMOTE STUDENT EDUCATION AND PARTICIPATION IN THE LIFELONG SPORT OF ARCHERY. BY PROVIDING THE FUNDING FOR THESE PROGRAMS, IT PROVIDES THE NECESSARY SUPPORT FOR R3 EFFORTS IN SOUTH DAKOTA AND WILL HELP DEVELOP AND USE PARTNERSHIPS TO HALT AND REVERSE THE DECLINING TREND IN HUNTING PARTICIPATION.
THIS GRANT WILL FUND SCDNR S SHOOTING SPORTS PROGRAMS.

PURPOSE: A MAJOR FOCUS FOR THE PROGRAM IS TO INSPIRE INCREASED INTEREST AND PARTICIPATION IN ARCHERY AND SHOOTINGSPORTS ACTIVITIES AND TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF YOUTH INTERESTED IN HUNTING AND OTHER OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES. THEARKANSAS NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM IS THE OFFICIAL ARKANSAS AFFILIATE OF THE NATIONAL ARCHERY INTHE SCHOOLS PROGRAM AND OPERATES USING NATIONAL GUIDELINES. THE ANASP IS FOCUSED ON PROVIDING A FUN, SAFEENVIRONMENT FOR PARTICIPATING IN ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOL SETTING WHILE RAISING AWARENESS OF CONSERVATION-RELATEDSPORTS, RESPONSIBILITY AND SELF-ESTEEM.OBJECTIVES:OBJECTIVE 1: TRAIN AT LEAST 24 INSTRUCTORS IN ARCHERY CERTIFICATION BY JUNE 30,2024.OBJECTIVE 2: CONDUCT 25 TRAINING EVENTS AT SCHOOLS AND OTHER LOCATIONS TO SUPPORT AND EXPAND ARCHERYOPPORTUNITIES BY JUNE 30,2024.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE AGFC BELIEVES THAT INCREASED PARTICIPATION IN ARCHERY AND SHOOTING SPORTS WILL INCREASE YOUTHS INTEREST INHUNTING. THIS INCREASE OF INTEREST, EXCITEMENT, AND PARTICIPATION WILL RESULT IN AN INCREASE OF LICENSE SALES.THESE COMBINED ELEMENTS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE OUTDOOR HERITAGE AND HUNTING CULTURE.THE AGFC WILL SEEK TO INCREASE STATE LICENSE SALES AND PARTICIPATION IN HUNTER EDUCATION THROUGH DIRECT MARKETINGTO THESE STUDENTS AND COACHES. THE ARKANSAS GAME AND FISH COMMISSION IS MAKING EVERY ATTEMPT IN HOPES THAT WEWILL SEE A RISE IN PARTICIPATION OF ALL SHOOTING SPORTS AND HUNTING ACTIVITIES AS WAS OUTLINED BY THE WALKERRESEARCH GROUP (WALKER ET. AL. 2013).INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL ARKANSAS STUDENTS GRADES 4-12SUB-RECIPIENTS: NONE

NC-W-SKILLED BASED RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION IN NORTH CAROLINA (NC-W-ENHANCED HUNTER EDUCATION AND SAFETY)THE NORTH CAROLINA WILDLIFE RESOURCES COMMISSION (WRC) IS CONCERNED ABOUT THE CONTINUED DECLINE OF HUNTERS AND SHOOTERS IN THE STATE. THIS DECLINE HAS BEEN WELL DOCUMENTED IN LITERATURE AND AGENCIES ARE TAKING AN ACTIVE ROLE TO REVERSE THE TREND AND ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION TO PROVIDE INCREASE ACCESS TO THE CONSTITUENCY. THE WRC BELIEVES EXPOSING A DIVERSE AUDIENCE TO THE SHOOTING SPORTS AND ADVANCE HUNTING SKILLS TECHNIQUES CAN INCREASE PARTICIPATION THUS STEMMING THE DECREASE IN HUNTING LICENSE SALES.

CALIFORNIA STATE LAW MANDATES THE DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW)  SHALL TAKE ALL STEPS NECESSARY TOENSURE THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF ITS CITIZENS ENGAGED IN ACTIVITIES REQUIRING THE USE OF HUNTING IMPLEMENTS (FISHAND GAME CODE SECTION 3049) .  FISH AND GAME CODE SECTION 3051 OUTLINES, IN PART, HOW THE CDFW MEETS THE MANDATES OF SECTION 3049.  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROVIDE FOR A COURSE OF INSTRUCTION IN HUNTER SAFETY, PRINCIPLES OFCONSERVATION, AND SPORTSMANSHIP, AND FOR THIS PURPOSE MAY COOPERATE WITH ANY REPUTABLE ASSOCIATION ORORGANIZATION HAVING AS ONE OF ITS OBJECTIVES THE PROMOTION OF HUNTER SAFETY, PRINCIPLES OF CONSERVATION, ANDSPORTSMANSHIP. THE CDFW MAY DESIGNATE AS A HUNTER SAFETY INSTRUCTOR ANY PERSON FOUND BY IT TO BE COMPETENT TOGIVE INSTRUCTION IN THE COURSES REQUIRED IN THIS ARTICLE. A PERSON SO APPOINTED SHALL GIVE THAT COURSE OFINSTRUCTION, AND, UPON COMPLETION THEREOF, SHALL ISSUE THE INSTRUCTED A CERTIFICATE OF COMPLETION AS PROVIDED BYTHE DEPARTMENT IN HUNTER SAFETY, PRINCIPLES OF CONSERVATION, AND SPORTSMANSHIP ...

IN 2002 THE KENTUCKY STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE PILOTED THE KENTUCKY ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM TO INTRODUCE SCHOOL AGE STUDENTS TO TARGET ARCHERY EDUCATION, AND TO ENCOURAGE MORE PARTICIPATION IN SHOOTING SPORTS. THE PROGRAM SET OUT TO DEVELOP A CURRICULUM IN WHICH STUDENTS WOULD RECEIVE HANDS ON LESSONS COVERING BASIC ARCHERY SKILLS IN SCHOOL, DURING THEIR PHYSICAL EDUCATION CLASSES. THE LESSONS ARE TAUGHT BY SCHOOLTEACHERS TO STUDENTS IN GRADES 4 12. THE PROGRAM IS INTENDED TO ENCOURAGE YOUTH PARTICIPATION IN WILDLIFE ASSOCIATED RECREATION AND OTHER ARCHERY RELATED ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BOW HUNTING. THE PROGRAM IN KENTUCKY SUCCESSFULLY EXPANDED, AND AS A RESULT, A NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM  NASP) WAS CREATED TO GIVE OTHER STATES THE OPPORTUNITY TO BRING A MODEL ARCHERY EDUCATION PROGRAM INTO SCHOOLS  PHYSICAL EDUCATION CLASSES. A TWO PHASE EVALUATION FOR NASP INVOLVING A SAMPLE OF STUDENTS AND TEACHERS FROM 10 STATES TEACHING THE PROGRAM INDICATED THAT 30  OF THE STUDENTS REPORTED THAT THEY ARE MORE INTERESTED IN HUNTING AND OTHER SHOOTING SPORTS SINCE TAKING THE ARCHERY PROGRAM IN SCHOOL. IN OCTOBER OF 2005, THE DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE  CDFW), OFFICE OF COMMUNICATION, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH  OCEO) ADOPTED THE KENTUCKY MODEL AND TRAINED 21 PHYSICAL EDUCATION TEACHERS AND 13 VOLUNTEER INSTRUCTORS TO IMPLEMENT NASP IN CALIFORNIA   HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS CALNASP. SUBSEQUENTLY, IN YEAR 2006, CDFW PILOTED THE CALNASP FOR ONE YEAR WITH 15 NORTHERN CALIFORNIA SCHOOLS WITH TEACHERS AND STUDENTS RANGING FROM ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE, AND HIGH SCHOOLS. DURING THIS TIME, 2,135 STUDENTS WERE INTRODUCED TO ARCHERY EDUCATION  14 OUT OF THE 15 SCHOOLS INDICATED THEY WOULD CONTINUE THE PROGRAM. BY THE END OF 2007, THE CALNASP PROGRAM EXPANDED TO APPROXIMATELY 350 SCHOOLS WITH THOUSANDS OF STUDENTS LEARNING BASIC ARCHERY SKILLS. IN ADDITION TO SCHOOLS ADOPTING TARGET ARCHERY AS A TAUGHT PE CURRICULUM, SOME HAVE ALSO IMPLEMENTED CALNASP AS AN AFTER SCHOOL OUTDOOR CLUB IN WHICH STUDENTS CAN EXPLORE OTHER OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITH ARCHERY AS A COMPONENT. FURTHERMORE, CALNASP CONTINUES TO OPERATE UNDER THE AGENCY VOLUNTEER MODEL AND HAS GROWN FROM 40 VOLUNTEER INSTRUCTORS IN 2018 TO 240 IN 2023. OF THESE INSTRUCTORS, 15 ARE AVAILABLE TO TRAIN MORE TEACHERS TO DELIVER AND GROW THE PROGRAM ALL ACROSS THE STATE. IN THE PAST, THE PROGRAM OPERATED WITH SMALL DONATIONS FROM CONSERVATION AND ARCHERY ASSOCIATIONS AND OTHER COMMUNITY GROUPS. HOWEVER, WITH A MORE STABLE FUNDING BASE, THE PROGRAM IS NO LONGER ISOLATED TO A FEW COUNTIES  WE ARE SEEING EXPANSION OF THE PROGRAM INTO MORE COUNTIES STATEWIDE, CURRENTLY REACHING 35 OF THE 58 COUNTIES IN CALIFORNIA. RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THAT YOUTH IN THE UNITED STATES ARE INCREASINGLY DISCONNECTED FROM OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES. THROUGH THE SUCCESS AND EXPANSION OF CALNASP WE CAN PROVIDE STUDENTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN A SKILL THAT EASILY TRANSLATES INTO AN OUTDOOR RECREATION, SUCH AS BOW HUNTING, IF THE STUDENT WISHES. THROUGH CALNASP, WE CAN ALSO INTRODUCE STUDENTS TO CONSERVATION AND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT CONCEPTS AS A PART OF SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES AND SUPPLEMENTAL CURRICULUM THAT ARE TAUGHT ALONG WITH ARCHERY EDUCATION.

PROVIDE FUNDS TO THIRD PARTY COOPERATORS FOR EXISTING SHOOTING RANGE MAINTENANCE AND UPGRADES. ALSO, PROVIDE GRANTS TO THIRD PARTIES TO ERECT OR FABRICATE NEW STRUCTURES OR OTHER PHYSICAL ENHANCEMENTS TO SHOOTING RANGES. THESE EFFORTS WILL BE MORE SUBSTANTIAL IN NATURE, IN AN EFFORT TO DEVELOP GREAT PLACES FOR THE PUBLIC TO SHOOT SAFELY.

ARCHERY EDUCATION THROUGH THE NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM (NASP) IS A KEY CONTRIBUTOR TOWARDS THE PHYSICAL DEVELOPMENT AND THE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL WELL BEING OF CHILDREN IN OUR STATE. THE INHERENT INDIVIDUAL NATURE OF ARCHERY LENDS ITSELFTO SAFE SOCIAL DISTANCING PROTOCOLS AND IS A UNIQUE TOOL FOR CREATING LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH. BY PROVIDING QUALITY INSTRUCTION AND COMPETITION, CHILDREN ARE GIVEN SAFE OPPORTUNITIES TO ENHANCE THEIR ARCHERY SKILLS.

THE PURPOSE OF THE FY 2023 FIELD TO FORK AS AN R3 STRATEGY PROJECT IS TO INCREASE HUNTER PARTICIPATION ON GUAM THE PROJECT INVOLVES HOSTING THREE EVENTS CALLED,  FIELD TO FORK , WHICH ARE HUNTS FOR PIGS CALLED BABUI ANDHUNTS FOR DEER CALLED BINADU AS ACTIVITIES TO RECRUIT, RETAIN, AND REACTIVATE  R3  HUNTERS  THE ACTIVITIES INTHE PROJECT INCLUDE ISLAND WIDE HUNTING AND MANDATORY SAFETY BRIEFINGS FOR PARTICIPANTS TO HUNT TOGETHER AND PASSON THEIR TRADITIONS OF HUNTING  PARTICIPANTS  ACTIVITIES WILL BE CAPTURED USING EVENT SURVEYS

THIS GRANT FUNDS ADMINISTRATION OF THE OREGON SHOOTING RANGE HUNTER EDUCATION ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM AT ODFW  THEHE PROGRAM WAS INITIATED UNDER THE PITTMAN ROBERTSON ACT  1937  TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FUNDING TO STATES FOR THEADMINISTRATION OF A GRANT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC SHOOTING RANGES  THE PROGRAM GIVES PUBLICSHOOTING RANGES ACCESS TO FUNDS FOR RANGE BUILDING, ENHANCEMENT OR EXPANSION THROUGH A COMPETITIVE APPLICATIONPROCESS  RANGES MUST PROVIDE CERTAIN LEVELS OF PUBLIC ACCESS TO BE ABLE TO QUALIFY FOR THE GRANTS  GRANTS AREAPPROVED OR DISAPPROVED BY A PANEL OF INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE A TIE TO SHOOTING SPORTS AND HUNTING, BUT NOTATTACHED TO A RANGE THAT HAS SUBMITTED AN APPLICATION, AS WELL AS BY US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICES

THE OBJECTIVE OF THE HUNTER RECRUITMENT, RETENTION AND REACTIVATION  R3  PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF NEW HUNTERS AND TRAPPERS ENTERING THE SPORT, REDUCE THE NUMBER OF HUNTERS AND TRAPPERS LEAVING THE SPORT AND ENCOURAGE INACTIVE HUNTERS AND TRAPPERS TO BECOME ACTIVE PARTICIPANTS ONCE AGAIN

CALIFORNIA STATE LAW MANDATES THE DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW) SHALL TAKE ALL STEPS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF ITS CITIZENS ENGAGED IN ACTIVITIES REQUIRING THE USE OF HUNTING IMPLEMENTS (FISH AND GAME CODE SECTION 3049).  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROVIDE FOR A COURSE OF INSTRUCTION IN HUNTER SAFETY, PRINCIPLES OF CONSERVATION, AND SPORTSMANSHIP, AND FOR THIS PURPOSE MAY COOPERATE WITH ANY REPUTABLE ASSOCIATION OR ORGANIZATION HAVING AS ONE OF ITS OBJECTIVES THE PROMOTION OF HUNTER SAFETY, PRINCIPLES OF CONSERVATION AND SPORTSMANSHIP.  THE CDFW MAY DESIGNATE AS A HUNTER SAFETY INSTRUCTOR ANY PERSON FOUND BY IT TO BE COMPETENT TO GIVE INSTRUCTION IN THE COURSES REQUIRED IN THIS ARTICLE. A PERSON SO APPOINTED SHALL GIVE THAT COURSE OF INSTRUCTION, AND, UPON COMPLETION THEREOF, SHALL ISSUE THE INSTRUCTED A CERTIFICATE OF COMPLETION AS PROVIDED BY THE DEPARTMENT IN HUNTER SAFETY, PRINCIPLES OF CONSERVATION, AND SPORTSMANSHIP.

YOUTH ARCHERY DEVELOPMENT IS KEY TO GROWING ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING SEGMENTS OF THE SHOOTING SPORTS IN THEUNITED STATES  SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 2004, THE NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM  NASP  HAS REACHED OVER25,000 YOUTH ANNUALLY IN NEBRASKA AND CONTINUES TO EXPAND TO OVER 315 SCHOOLS IN NEBRASKA  THE PROGRAM PROVIDESYOUTH WITH A TWO WEEK FOUNDATIONAL ARCHERY SKILLS PROGRAM, PREPARING YOUTH FOR THE FIELD BY PROVIDING SAFEARCHERY HANDLING SKILLS, ARCHERY SHOOTING SKILLS AND OVERALL ARCHERY SPORTS DEVELOPMENT, FURTHER SUPPORT NEBRASKA R3 EFFORTS

FLORIDA HUNTER SAFETY SHOOTING RANGE (ENHANCEMENT) GRANT. THERE IS A NEED FOR HUNTERS TO HAVE A SAFE PLACE TO LEARN AND PRACTICE SAFE GUN HANDLING AND USE TECHNIQUES AND PROCEDURES. THIS PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO ENHANCE OVERALL OPERATIONS AND SAFETY AT FLORIDA SHOOTING RANGES. EACH OF THE 11 RANGES MANAGED BY FWC ARE IN CONTINUOUS NEED OF REFURBISHING, UPGRADING, RENOVATING AND/OR EXPANSION. THE HUNTER EDUCATION PROGRAM SEEKS TO REPLACE WORN OUT TARGETS, BAFFLES, BACKSTOPS AND EQUIPMENT SO AS TO ENHANCE TRAINING EFFORTS.

THE ENHANCED HUNTER EDUCATION GRANT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR IMPLEMENTING PRODUCTS USED STATEWIDE. THIS INCLUDES THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF THE HUNTER EDUCATION WEB PAGES, INSTRUCTOR RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING MATERIALS, AND STUDENT MANUALS AND EDUCATIONAL VIDEOS. ADDITIONALLY, THE GRANT WILL FUND PROMOTING THE HUNTER EDUCATION COURSES OFFERED AND RECRUIT INSTRUCTORS THROUGH THE WEBSITE AND SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. THE PROGRAM EXPECTS TO DEVELOP AND DELIVER 25,256 PRINT PRODUCTS AND 6 DIGITAL PRODUCTS, AND REACH 36,000 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH THE HUNTEREDUCATION WEB PAGES.
THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE SC SHOOTING SPORTS PROGRAMS FOR FY 22-23

THE NORTH CAROLINA WILDLIFE RESOURCES COMMISSION (WRC) IS CONCERNED ABOUT THE CONTINUED DECLINE OF HUNTERS AND SHOOTERS IN THE STATE. THIS DECLINE HAS BEEN WELL DOCUMENTED IN LITERATURE AND AGENCIES ARE TAKING AN ACTIVE ROLE TO REVERSE THE TREND AND ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION TO PROVIDE INCREASE ACCESS TO THE CONSTITUENCY. THE WRC BELIEVES EXPOSING A DIVERSE AUDIENCE TO THE SHOOTING SPORTS AND ADVANCE HUNTING SKILLS TECHNIQUES CAN INCREASE PARTICIPATION THUS STEMMING THE DECREASE IN HUNTING LICENSE SALES.IN A PARTNERSHIP WITH PUBLIC, PRIVATE AND HOMESCHOOL ORGANIZATIONS THE WRC WILL IMPLEMENT THE NASP CURRICULUM TO TEACH ARCHERY TO STUDENTS IN GRADES FOUR THROUGH TWELVE. BOTH ORGANIZATIONS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO TRAIN TEACHERS AS CERTIFIED ARCHERY INSTRUCTORS AND INSTRUCTOR-TRAINERS. THE CURRICULUM IS CONSISTENT WITH THE FEDERAL AID HANDBOOK, CHAPTER 13.2 A, AND ALLOWS STUDENTS TO LEARN ARCHERY SKILLS INCLUDING SAFETY, SHOOTING ACCURATELY, SELECTING AND MAINTAINING EQUIPMENT, RANGE PROCEDURES, HISTORY, AND ETIQUETTE. THE WRC WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THE KNOWLEDGE BASE OF THE VOLUNTEER HUNTER EDUCATION INSTRUCTORS TO MORE EFFECTIVELY DELIVER ADVANCED SKILL-BASED HUNTER EDUCATION TO STUDENTS (ESP. ARCHERY, MUZZLELOADING, ORIENTEERING, SURVIVAL, WILDLIFE IDENTIFICATION ANDOTHER ADVANCED HUNTING SKILLS TECHNIQUES). THESE TRAINING WILL INCREASE PARTICIPATION OF THE INSTRUCTORS AND CREATE MORE OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS THUS STEMMING THE DECREASE IN HUNTING PARTICIPATION BY REDUCING THE KNOWLEDGE BARRIER OF POTENTIAL FUTURE PARTICIPANTS. WRC WILL ADMINISTER THE NASP, RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION STRATEGIES AND OTHER ADVANCED HUNTER EDUCATION SKILLS PROGRAMS BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING TASKS:DEVELOPMENT, COORDINATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PROGRAMS THAT ARE INTENDED TO INCREASE PARTICIPATION IN SHOOTING RELATED ACTIVITIES: SKEET, TRAP, CLAY, ARCHERY, OR TARGET.PARTNER WITH EXISTING SHOOTING SPORTS PROGRAMS TO OFFER EQUIPMENT-SPECIFIC (BOW, SHOTGUN, RIFLE, HANDGUN) LIVE-FIRE OPPORTUNITIES.IDENTIFY AND PARTICIPATE IN PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON ENGAGING NEW CONSTITUENTS THROUGH SCHOOLS, UNIVERSITIES, NGOS, PARKS AND RECREATION ORGANIZATIONS, HUNTER/ANGLER RECRUITS AND OTHERS DEEMED NECESSARY.COORDINATE NATIONAL COMPREHENSIVE STRATEGIES IDENTIFIED BY THE COUNCIL FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF HUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTS TO POSITIVELY INFLUENCE PARTICIPATION TRENDS. THE EXPECTATION IS THAT THESE STRATEGIES WILL BE SUPPORTED AND IMPLEMENTED WITH COOPERATION OF OTHER STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES AND THE HUNTING, TRAPPING AND SHOOTING SPORTS COMMUNITIES.PARTNER WITH PUBLIC, PRIVATE AND HOMESCHOOL ORGANIZATIONS TO IMPLEMENT THE NASP CURRICULUM TO TEACH ARCHERY TO STUDENTS IN GRADES FOUR THROUGH TWELVE. BOTH ORGANIZATIONS WILL ALSO WORK TOGETHER TO TRAIN TEACHERS AS CERTIFIED ARCHERY INSTRUCTORS AND INSTRUCTOR-TRAINERS.

PURPOSE: TO INSPIRE INCREASED INTEREST AND PARTICIPATION IN ARCHERY AND SHOOTING SPORTS ACTIVITIES AND TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF YOUTH INTERESTED IN HUNTING AND OTHER OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES.OBJECTIVE 1: TRAIN AT LEAST 24 INSTRUCTORS IN ARCHERY CERTIFICATION BY JUNE 30,2023.OBJECTIVE 2: CONDUCT 25 TRAINING EVENTS AT SCHOOLS TO SUPPORT AND EXPAND ARCHERY OPPORTUNITIES BY JUNE 30,2023.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASE IN YOUTH INTEREST IN HUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTSINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL ARKANSAS STUDENTS GRADES 4-12SUB-RECIPIENTS: NONE

HUNTING IS A LONG STANDING TRADITION IN THE STATE OF UTAH AND AN IMPORTANT PART OF OUR HERITAGE. THE DIVISION OF WILDLIFE RESOURCES IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING STRUCTURED OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS TO BE INTRODUCE TO SHOOTING AND HUNTING, AS WELL AS PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THOSE ALREADY INVOLVED IN THE SPORT TO IMPROVE THEIR SKILLS AND FOSTER CONTINUED INTEREST IN PARTICIPATION OR TO REACTIVATE PAST PARTICIPANTS. THE HUNTER EDUCATION OUTREACH AND SHOOTING SPORT EFFORTS PROVIDE MANY OF THESE OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUR CITIZENS.THIS GRANT PROJECT PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE UTAH HUNTER EDUCATION OUTREACH AND SHOOTING SPORTS PROGRAMS. PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION INCLUDES: PLANNING, CONDUCTING OR SUPPORTING A VARIETY OF LOCAL, REGIONAL AND STATE LEVEL EVENTS DESIGNED TO INCREASE INTEREST AND PARTICIPATION IN HUNTING, TRAPPING OR SHOOTING SPORTS ACTIVITIES; VOLUNTEER TRAINING AND RECOGNITION; PROCUREMENT OF ASSOCIATED SUPPLIES AND MATERIALS, ETC.

SOUTH DAKOTA GFP CREATED THE SHOOTING RANGE DEVELOPMENT GRANT PROGRAM IN 1971 TO ENCOURAGE THE NEW DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVEMENT OF SHOOTING RANGES BY OFFERING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THIRD PARTY COOPERATORS AND PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO THE NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM (NASP) AND SHOOTING RELATED SPORTS PROGRAMS. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS GRANT IS TO RENOVATE THREE SHOOTING RANGES, TO HELP OPERATE AND MAINTAIN TWENTY-FIVE FACILITIES, TRAIN 342 NASP INSTRUCTORS/MENTORS, TO HAVE 4,000 STUDENTS COMPLETE NASP TRAINING, AND TO CONDUCT EIGHT NASP TRAINING EVENTS. THE EXPECTED RESULTS AND BENEFITS ARE TO PROVIDE A SAFE PLACE FOR HUNTER EDUCATION AND THE PUBLIC TO DEVELOP AND PRACTICE SHOOTING SKILLS. THE NASP PROGRAM WILL PROMOTE STUDENT EDUCATION AND PARTICIPATION IN THE LIFELONG SPORT OF ARCHERY. BY PROVIDING THE FUNDING FOR THESE PROGRAMS IT PROVIDES THE NECESSARY SUPPORT FOR R3 EFFORTS IN SOUTH DAKOTA AND WILL HELP DEVELOP AND USE PARTNERSHIPS TO HALT AND REVERSE THE DECLINING TREND IN HUNTING PARTICIPATION.

IN 2002 THE KENTUCKY STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE PILOTED THE KENTUCKY ARCHERY IN THE  SCHOOLS PROGRAM TO INTRODUCE SCHOOL-AGE STUDENTS TO TARGET ARCHERY EDUCATION, AND TO ENCOURAGE MORE PARTICIPATION  IN SHOOTING SPORTS. THE PROGRAM SET OUT TO DEVELOP A CURRICULUM IN WHICH STUDENTS WOULD RECEIVE HANDS-ON LESSONS  COVERING BASIC ARCHERY SKILLS IN SCHOOL, DURING THEIR PHYSICAL EDUCATION CLASSES. THE LESSONS ARE TAUGHT BY  SCHOOLTEACHERS TO STUDENTS IN GRADES 4-12. THE PROGRAM IS INTENDED TO ENCOURAGE YOUTH PARTICIPATION IN WILDLIFE ASSOCIATED RECREATION AND OTHER ARCHERY-RELATED ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BOW HUNTING.THE PROGRAM IN KENTUCKY SUCCESSFULLY EXPANDED, AND AS A RESULT, A NATIONAL ARCHERY IN THE SCHOOLS PROGRAM (NASP)  WAS CREATED TO GIVE OTHER STATES THE OPPORTUNITY TO BRING A MODEL ARCHERY-EDUCATION PROGRAM INTO SCHOOLS'  PHYSICAL EDUCATION CLASSES. A TWO-PHASE EVALUATION FOR NASP INVOLVING A SAMPLE OF STUDENTS AND TEACHERS FROM 10  STATES TEACHING THE PROGRAM INDICATED THAT 30% OF THE STUDENTS REPORTED THAT THEY ARE MORE INTERESTED IN HUNTING  AND OTHER SHOOTING SPORTS SINCE TAKING THE ARCHERY PROGRAM IN SCHOOL.IN OCTOBER OF 2005, THE DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW), OFFICE OF COMMUNICATION, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH  (OCEO) TRAINED 21 PHYSICAL EDUCATION TEACHERS AND 13 VOLUNTEER INSTRUCTORS TO IMPLEMENT NASP IN CALIFORNIA -  HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS CALNASP. SUBSEQUENTLY, IN YEAR 2006, CDFW PILOTED THE CALNASP FOR ONE YEAR WITH 15  NORTHERN CALIFORNIA SCHOOLS WITH TEACHERS AND STUDENTS RANGING FROM ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE, AND HIGH SCHOOLS. DURING  THIS TIME, 2,135 STUDENTS WERE INTRODUCED TO ARCHERY EDUCATION; 14 OUT OF THE 15 SCHOOLS INDICATED THEY WOULD  CONTINUE THE PROGRAM.BY THE END OF 2007, THE CALNASP PROGRAM EXPANDED TO APPROXIMATELY 350 SCHOOLS WITH THOUSANDS OF STUDENTS LEARNING  BASIC ARCHERY SKILLS. IN ADDITION TO SCHOOLS ADOPTING TARGET ARCHERY AS A TAUGHT PE CURRICULUM, SOME HAVE ALSO  IMPLEMENTED CALNASP AS AN AFTER-SCHOOL-OUTDOOR CLUB IN WHICH STUDENTS CAN EXPLORE OTHER OUTDOOR-RECREATIONAL  ACTIVITIES WITH ARCHERY AS A COMPONENT.FURTHERMORE, CALNASP CONTINUES TO OPERATE UNDER THE AGENCY/VOLUNTEER MODEL AND HAS GROWN FROM 40 VOLUNTEER  INSTRUCTORS IN 2018 TO 240 IN 2022. THESE INSTRUCTORS ARE AVAILABLE TO TRAIN TEACHERS TO DELIVER AND GROW THE  PROGRAM ALL ACROSS THE STATE.IN THE PAST, THE PROGRAM OPERATED WITH SMALL DONATIONS FROM CONSERVATION AND ARCHERY ASSOCIATIONS AND OTHER  COMMUNITY GROUPS. HOWEVER, WITH A MORE STABLE FUNDING BASE, THE PROGRAM IS NO LONGER ISOLATED TO A FEW COUNTIES;  WE ARE SEEING EXPANSION OF THE PROGRAM INTO MORE COUNTIES STATEWIDE, CURRENTLY REACHING 178 COUNTIES IN  CALIFORNIA.RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THAT YOUTH IN THE UNITED STATES ARE INCREASINGLY DISCONNECTED FROM OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES. THROUGH  THE SUCCESS AND EXPANSION OF CALNASP WE CAN PROVIDE STUDENTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN A SKILL THAT EASILY  TRANSLATES INTO AN OUTDOOR RECREATION, SUCH AS BOW HUNTING, IF THE STUDENT WISHES. THROUGH CALNASP, WE CAN ALSO  INTRODUCE STUDENTS TO CONSERVATION AND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT CONCEPTS AS A PART OF SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES AND  SUPPLEMENTAL CURRICULUM THAT ARE TAUGHT ALONG WITH ARCHERY EDUCATION.
